metadata.title: Fast-tracking biosensor design using high-throughput computational workflows
metadata.description:
Situation: Developing novel biosensors has significant potential to solve various medical, environmental, agricultural and biotechnological challenges. One effective sensing mechanism involves engineering binding proteins, which emit a signal upon detecting their target. Traditional design approaches require extensive experimentation, labour intensive protein design and have high failure rates. Recently, the explosion of deep-learning tools has unlocked the potential for rapid design of protein-based biosensor recognition elements against almost any target molecule, completely from scratch. However, robust workflows rely on substantial computational resources and experimental validation of such approaches is still a bottleneck.

Task: The purpose of this study is to construct and validate a high-throughput computational workflow for the rapid development of protein-based biosensors.

Action: The workflow employs three recently developed deep-learning tools: RFdiffusion for generating biosensor backbone structures, LigandMPNN for decoding amino acid sequences of each structure and AlphaFold for predicting the structure of protein-binder complexes. Due to the high memory and compute requirements of Alphafold, the Google Vertex AI platform was used to considerably increase prediction throughput. In addition to deep-learning methods, physics-based tools including molecular dynamics simulations (Amber22) and RosettaScripts, were used to assess and optimise designs. 

Result: Our computational workflow has generated thousands of biosensor designs against various targets including organisms, proteins and small molecules. Experimental testing is underway to validate the workflow. The computational approach enables significantly accelerated biosensor development.

data.title: Fast-tracking biosensor design using high-throughput computational workflows

metadata.title: Google AI for scientific research
metadata.description:
This presentation focuses on how Google AI technology can unblock & fast-track key research initiatives. It elaborates cutting-edge Google AI innovations from Google Deepmind and Google Cloud, including 
    AlphaFold v2 and v3 
    Med-Gemini
    Generative AI for research
    Vertex AI - unified Predictive & Generative AI platform
    Colab Enterprise
    Google Earth Engine etc. 
The session concludes with practical use cases in the field while Google AI help scientists break new grounds in research.

metadata.title: Tailoring HPC for medical research: lessons from the Melbourne Parkville Precinct
metadata.description:
HPC as a research tool has existed for decades, but HPC uptake in Medical Research Institutes (MRIs) is relatively new, driven by the proliferation of genomics and bioinformatics; the advent of CryoEM and imaging technologies; and more recently, AI technologies like Alphafold. This uptake is still increasing as more medical researchers are integrating HPC into their research, prompting MRIs to establish their own on-premises HPC. The narrower target audience at MRIs allows for a tailored HPC solution, but the nature of the research and the research software presents its own challenges. 
This talk presents perspectives from institutes in Melbourne s renowned Parkville medical research precinct (WEHI, MCRI, Peter MacCallum Cancer Centre, as well as Melbourne University), regarding the adaptation of the HPC concept for MRIs. The talk covers challenges and solutions (if any) for the following areas:
1.Key research technologies and software driving the hardware and filesystem decisions and HPC scheduler policies decisions
2.Researcher profiles and implications for cluster usage, including the necessity of interactive jobs, facilitated by Open OnDemand and other GUI platforms
3.Data management considerations, including HPC filesystem considerations, sensitive data handling, and sharing.
4.Important learnings taken from more established HPC facilities.
5.Finally, ongoing challenges will be presented.

data.title: Tailoring HPC for medical research: lessons from the Melbourne Parkville Precinct

metadata.title: Google Generative AI in Research and AlphaFold at Scale
metadata.description: In this session, we will walk through how Google AI & Generative AI services can be applied to address some pressing research challenges and how they can accelerate the research process. We will also discuss the security & privacy considerations of using Google Generative AI in research. This session is intended for researchers who are interested in using Google Generative AI to improve their research. Also we will provide latest field updates about running AlphaFold at scale.

data.title: Google Generative AI in Research and AlphaFold at Scale

metadata.title: Models generated by AlphaFold3 used for CASP16 predictions
metadata.description:
Elofsson and AF3-server predictions for CASP16

Organisation

The file Targets.MD contains comments about predictions and choices made for each target

Code

in bin/ all scripts used during the predictions are made available

Targets

All submitted targets for Elofsson (#241) and AF3-server (#304) can be found in targets/ (gzipped)

Scores

The file scores.csv contains all the pTM/ipTM/Ranking_confidence values for all models generated. In most cases the highest ranking_confidence score relates to the Elofsson prediction. and the fold_XYYYY_summary_confidences_0 related to the prediction submitted as the AF3-server. However, for large targets and round 0 models this is not always the case. Note also that for round 1 models often round 0 models are submitted. Due to space limitations

 

Please also examine the git repository for this project

 

 https://github.com/ElofssonLab/casp16/

 

Paper available here

https://doi.org/10.1101/2025.04.10.648174

grants.title: Predictions of protein-protein   interactions by PconsDock, a fold-and-dock algorithm

data.title: Models generated by AlphaFold3 used for CASP16 predictions

metadata.title: A global survey of intramolecular isopeptide bonds
metadata.description:
Data for "A global survey of intramolecular isopeptide bonds"

Francesco Costa1, Ioannis Riziotis1, Antonina Andreeva1, Delhi Kalwan2, Jennifer de Jong2, Philip Hinchliffe3, Fabio Parmeggiani2,4,5, Paul R. Race2,6, Steven G. Burston2, Alex Bateman1, Rob Barringer2

1 European Molecular Biology Laboratory, European Bioinformatics Institute (EMBL-EBI), Wellcome Genome Campus, Hinxton. CB10 1SD. UK

2 School of Biochemistry, University of Bristol, University Walk, Bristol. BS8 1TD. UK

3 School of Cellular and Molecular Medicine, University of Bristol, University Walk, Bristol, BS8 1TD, UK.

4 School of Chemistry, University of Bristol, Cantock’s Close, Bristol. BS8 1TS. UK

5 School of Pharmacy and Pharmaceutical Sciences, Cardiff University, Redwood Building, Cardiff. CF10 3NB , UK

6 School of Natural and Environmental Sciences, Devonshire Building, Newcastle University, Newcastle upon Tyne. NE1 7RU. UK

 

The following files are present:

- afdb_scan_isopeptor.csv and bfvd_scan_isopeptor.csv contain the results of isopeptor scans across AFDB and BFVD databases. Columns:
    - uniprot_acc: uniprot accession code
    - probability: isopeptor's probability of isopeptide bond
    - r{1_bond,_cat,2_bond}: position of respectively the first bonded residue, the catalytic residue and the second bonded residue; 
    - r{1_bond,_cat,2_bond}: name of respectively the first bonded residue, the catalytic residue and the second bonded residue;
    - bond_type: CnaA-like or CnaB-like classification;
    - rmsd: root mean square deviation with the closest matching template expressed in Angstrom;
    - r_asa: average relative accessible solvent area of the three isopeptide bond residues;
    - template: name of the closest structural template;
    - pfamA_acc,pfamA_id,clan_acc,clan_id: pfam domain accession code, name, clan accession code and name of the domain which matches the region of the isopeptide bond;
    - seq_start,seq_end: pfam domain sequence start and end;
    - taxonomy,species,kingdom: taxonomy, species and superkingdom annotations;
    - r{1,2,3}_plddt: plddt of respectively the first bonded residue, the catalytic residue and the second bonded residue;
- pdb_isopeptide_models_biochemical_analysis.csv and af2_isopeptide_models_biochemical_analysis.csv contain the biochemical analysis performed on the dataset of intramolecular isopeptide bond structures. Note that the original table was derived from Costa et al., 2025 and that structures of re-modelled isopeptide bonds are available in the following public repository: https://github.com/FranceCosta/Isopeptor_development 
Common columns:
    - PDB code
    - Chain
    - UniProt Id
    - Species 
    - Name: protein name
    - Position 1 (Bond 1)
    - Residue 1: residue name
    - Position 2 (catalytic)
    - Residue 2 
    - Position 3 (Bond 2)
    - Residue 3
    - Isopeptide type: CnaA-like, CnaB-like or mutant;
    - Domain insert in loop?
    - Insertion name?
    - Reference
    - Bad rotamer: assigned to isopeptide bonds which have been not modelled correctly and which were not re-modelled due to the lack of electron density maps (data from Costa et al., 2025);
    - Deposition date
    - Fixed: indicates if the isopeptide bond structure has been remodelled;
    - Resolution
    - Unusual geometry/chemistry: indicates cases of unusual geometry or chemistry of the isopeptide bond (e.g. incomplete or missing sidechains, present on a flexible loops etc.)
    - bond_length
    - pseudo_omega
    - pseudo_psi
    - pseudo_phi
    
    Columns only present in pdb_isopeptide_models_biochemical_analysis.csv:
    - aro_res_id: residue number of the closest aromatic residue within a radius of 10 Å from the isopeptide bond NZ atom;
    - aro_res_name: residue name of the closest aromatic residue within a radius of 10 Å from the isopeptide bond NZ atom;
    - distance_to_aro: distance between isopeptide bond NZ atom and the centroid of the aromatic residue ring (the closer ring is considered for trypthophan)
    - aro_plane_normal-isopep_NZ_angle: angle between the isopeptide bond NZ atom vector and the aromatic plane normal; 
    - aro_cap: if the aromatic residue forms an "aromatic cap" with the isopeptide bond (distance within 6 Å and angle <30° or >150°);
    - water_resid_OD: residue number of closest water molecule within a radius of 5 Å from the isopeptide bond OD atom;
    - water_distance_OD: water molecule distance to isopeptide bond OD atom;
    - o_atom_ref: reference of closest O atom to the isopeptide bond OD atom (within a radius of 5 Å)
    - o_atom_distance: distance of closest O atom to isopeptide bond OD atom (within a radius of 5 Å);
    - rASA: per-residue relative solvent accessible area 
    - cis_trans: if the bond is in a cis (pseudo_omega angle < 60) or trans (pseudo_omega angle > 120) conformation;

    Columns only present in af2_isopeptide_models_biochemical_analysis.csv:
    - r{1,2,3}_af: position of respectively the first bonded residue, the catalytic residue and the second bonded residue in the AlphaFold model;  

- afdb_scan_isopeptor_pfam_annotations.csv contains all the Pfam domain annotations of the proteins detected by isopeptor in the AFDB scan;
- fa_pred.csv contains the results of the fibrillar adhesin prediction;
- alphafold2_models.zip.gz contains the compressed results of AlphaFold2 modelling described in this study;
- afdb_bacteria_random_sequences.csv and afdb_archaea_random_sequences.csv contain randomly selected protein uniprot acession code, length and taxonomy of Bacteria and Archaea extracted from the AFDB and used in this study;

References:

Costa,F. et al. (2025) Isopeptor: a tool for detecting intramolecular isopeptide bonds in protein structures. Bioinformatics Advances, vbaf049.

For questions, contact:
Francesco Costa
Email: fcosta@ebi.ac.uk

creators.name: Costa, Francesco
creators.affiliation: European Molecular Biology Laboratory - European Bioinformatics Institute

references: Costa,F. et al. (2025) Isopeptor: a tool for detecting intramolecular isopeptide bonds in protein structures. Bioinformatics Advances, vbaf049

data.title: A global survey of intramolecular isopeptide bonds

metadata.title: SOX9-2025
metadata.description:
Search result of the part of the SOX9 IDR region (409-478) against the alphafold database

  • core_logo_logo_text.png: PNG file of logo plot for the region. Output of the CIAlign.
  • core_logo_log.txt: a log file used to create a logo plot. Output of the CIAlign.
  • core_logo_cleaned.fasta: a fasta file used to create a logo plot. Output of the CIAlign.
  • afdb_aln.m8: a search result m8 file. A query was a whole SOX9 sequence.
  • afdb_aln.a3m: a result MSA computed with the search result afdb_aln.m8, centered to the query
  • afdb_aln.kraken: a Kraken-style output of taxonomy report using afdb_aln.m8 as an input.
  • afdb_sub_aln50.m8: a search result m8 file. A query was the region of SOX9, and the target was the searched sequences from afdb_aln.m8
  • afdb_sub_aln50.a3m: a result MSA computed with the sequences in afdb_sub_aln50.m8, centered to the query
  • afdb_sub_aln50.kraken: a Kraken-style output of taxonomy report using afdb_sub_aln50.m8 as an input.
